items.description:
Sorry to have another late edition. My only excuse is that I've started blogging again. ;-)

So this is a massive issue full of great content, hopefully enough to get you through the week ahead.

items.title: Universal AppLinks on iOS
items.description:
I was lucky to be tasked to get Universal AppLinks working, for a cool feature in the TrackMan Golf App I work on at work. I thought this would be super easy to do. But, oh how naive and wrong I was.

Universal AppLinks on iOS by Tomasz Cielecki

I was lucky to be tasked to get Universal AppLinks working, for a cool feature in the TrackMan Golf App I work on at work. I thought this would be super easy to do. But, oh how naive and wrong I was.

items.title: Understanding iOS Image Assets
items.description:
When developing apps you'll come to the point where you'll need to deal with image assets. No matter how crudiest the UI could be, you'll probably need some icons or small image resources to compose your layouts. In this post we'll explore how image assets works on iOS.

Understanding iOS Image Assets by Rafael Veronezi
items.description_markdown:
When developing apps you'll come to the point where you'll need to deal with image assets. No matter how crudiest the UI could be, you'll probably need some icons or small image resources to compose your layouts. In this post we'll explore how image assets works on iOS.

[**Understanding iOS Image Assets**](https://www.mfractor.com/blogs/news/understanding-ios-image-assets) by [Rafael Veronezi](https://github.com/ravero)

items.title: Calling methods in your View from your ViewModel using Action-Invokes
items.description:
Executing ViewModel methods from Xamarin Forms Pages is easy, but how can Page methods be called inside ViewModels?

Calling methods in your View from your ViewModel using Action-Invokes | by The First Prototype | Apr, 2021 | Medium by Saamer Mansoor
items.description_markdown:
Executing ViewModel methods from Xamarin Forms Pages is easy, but how can Page methods be called inside ViewModels?

[**Calling methods in your View from your ViewModel using Action-Invokes | by The First Prototype | Apr, 2021 | Medium**](https://prototypemakers.medium.com/calling-methods-in-your-view-from-your-viewmodel-using-action-invokes-e18682d7d95c) by [Saamer Mansoor](https://medium.com/@prototypemakers)

embedded_links.title: **Calling methods in your View from your ViewModel using Action-Invokes | by The First Prototype | Apr, 2021 | Medium**

items.title: Replicating a Facebook Like UI in Xamarin
items.description:
In this blog post, we'll be replicating a Facebook UI in Xamarin.Forms. The Facebook app contains some basic modules like a login page, timeline/wall page, profile page, and some other pages for modifying the settings and creating commercial pages.

Replicating a Facebook Like UI in Xamarin | Syncfusion Blogs by Selva Ganapathy Kathiresan
items.description_markdown:
In this blog post, we'll be replicating a Facebook UI in Xamarin.Forms. The Facebook app contains some basic modules like a login page, timeline/wall page, profile page, and some other pages for modifying the settings and creating commercial pages. 

[**Replicating a Facebook Like UI in Xamarin | Syncfusion Blogs**](https://www.syncfusion.com/blogs/post/replicating-a-facebook-like-ui-in-xamarin.aspx) by [Selva Ganapathy Kathiresan](https://www.syncfusion.com/blogs/author/selva-ganapathy-k)

items.title: Implement Drag & Drop in Your Xamarin.Forms App
items.description:
Xamarin.Forms now has the DragGestureRecognizer and DropGestureRecognizer, enabling you to implement drag and drop in your apps! In this video we will see how to get started with adding drag and drop to your app and enriching the data that you're transporting.

Implement Drag & Drop in Your Xamarin.Forms App by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
Xamarin.Forms now has the DragGestureRecognizer and DropGestureRecognizer, enabling you to implement drag and drop in your apps! In this video we will see how to get started with adding drag and drop to your app and enriching the data that you're transporting.

[**Implement Drag & Drop in Your Xamarin.Forms App**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xFXnkRmTKrI) by [Gerald Versluis](https://blog.verslu.is/author/admin/)

embedded_links.title: **Implement Drag & Drop in Your Xamarin.Forms App**

items.title: Xamarin.Forms Shell Login Page Flow
items.description:
We are back to Xamarin.Forms navigation with Shell. This time taking your request directly to do a login flow with URL based navigation. We start off login in users and then popping them into the main app and allowing them to log out. With Xamarin.Forms Shell it can be easily accomplished.

Xamarin.Forms Shell Login Page Flow by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
We are back to Xamarin.Forms navigation with Shell. This time taking your request directly to do a login flow with URL based navigation. We start off login in users and then popping them into the main app and allowing them to log out. With Xamarin.Forms Shell it can be easily accomplished.

[**Xamarin.Forms Shell Login Page Flow**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ylbgWHB_gMI) by [James Montemagno](https://channel9.msdn.com/niners/jamesmontemagno)

items.title: Video in Your Xamarin.Forms App with MediaElement
items.description:
Audio and video are big parts of apps nowadays. If you need to add those in your Xamarin.Forms app, you can do so with the MediaElement. MediaElement is a part of the Xamarin Community Toolkit and allows you to play media from remote URLs to embedded sources and anything in between.

Video in Your Xamarin.Forms App with MediaElement by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
Audio and video are big parts of apps nowadays. If you need to add those in your Xamarin.Forms app, you can do so with the MediaElement. MediaElement is a part of the Xamarin Community Toolkit and allows you to play media from remote URLs to embedded sources and anything in between.

[**Video in Your Xamarin.Forms App with MediaElement**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yJAKkz17WDo) by [Gerald Versluis](https://blog.verslu.is/author/admin/)

embedded_links.title: **Video in Your Xamarin.Forms App with MediaElement**

items.title: Null Pointers 49: Authentication
items.description:
Authenticating a user is often more than meets the user's eye. In this episode, we discuss the challenges, options and our experiences with said topic. We dive into some OAuth, do our best to pronounce Auth0 and discover the passcode to Geralds top-secret studio vault.

49: Authentication by Null Pointers
items.description_markdown:
Authenticating a user is often more than meets the user's eye. In this episode, we discuss the challenges, options and our experiences with said topic. We dive into some OAuth, do our best to pronounce Auth0 and discover the passcode to Geralds top-secret studio vault.
